website_summaries.verdict: A smaller Hamilton Beach toaster oven that still has some of the features of the larger models, but for a lower price.
pros: Fits four slices of toast or a 9-inch pizza
Includes a 30-minute timer with auto-shutoff or an optional stay-on setting
Roll-top door gives easy access to food without taking up extra counter space
cons: Some buyers noted a small gap when the door is shut, which lets out heat
If you need less than 10 minutes of cook time, you have to turn the timer past 10 minutes first and then go back

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, bad design
customer_reviews.text: Great idea for easy reach. Was hoping it would be just a bit bigger. The bottom knob is terrible. It "tocks" like a clock which is extra noise and doesn't adjust where you want it to. You have to use a lot of force to turn the knob because you're winding a clock I guess. Not user friendly especially when you're in a rush The heating element is too large (one on the top and one on the bottom). Anything that falls or drips on it will start to smoke real quick. I'm sure it has smoked almost every time I use it. Pretty annoying....
customer_reviews.author: white_ninja

customer_reviews.title: Defective oven door with  half inch gap running alongside entire right side.
customer_reviews.text: Would have loved this oven, but there was a half inch gap running along entire right side of oven door. All the heat escaped through the gap. Really too bad, calibration issue. Super cute, clean design with defective oven door, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Numbers wear off
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old toaster oven I used for over 20 years. It works for reheating pizza and cooking small batches of frozen french fries. I chose this because of the lift-up door. On my old toaster oven, crumbs and bits of cheese were always dripping on the door . Drawbacks - the minute numbers are very lightly painted on around the dial. Even though I was very careful, some of the numbers have already disappeared - worn off by my fingers when I turned the dial, or perhaps wiped off when I cleaned it (gently). I have yet to figure out how to clean the inside of the door.
customer_reviews.author: Not Old Yet

customer_reviews.title: Great for everything!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t have a microwave or anything, but I feel like I can use this for everything. It heats up super fast. Be careful to not burn yourself from the steam when you open it though. My boyfriend and I really like the look of the door - we like how it slides up and down as well as seeing what is cooking so you know exactly when it is finished! The best toaster over I’ve know and I’m very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Chaudry

customer_reviews.title: its super petite but gets the job done if you're not ...
customer_reviews.text: saw this guy at a target and had to have it. unlike most mini toaster ovens it opens with the door sliding up instead of flopping down. lowers my burning-the-counter-top-with-hot-glass anxiety. its super petite but gets the job done if you're not wanting to heat up the entire house for a little single-person serving size of cookies or open face cheese toast
customer_reviews.author: insanitysaber

customer_reviews.title: Best toaster-oven in forty years!
customer_reviews.text: Safe to use under cabinet and against wall since no heat radiates upward or back. Does have slight, 1/16" gap between door and unit on one side, but not a problem. Two rack positions, twenty-minute timer, large interior, easy to use w/o burning fingers on door, simple to clean, and looks spiffy!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah A. Levy

customer_reviews.title: Highest temperature setting is not sufficient for anything excpet toasting.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for toasting bagels and sliced bread and it works great for just that. Last night I used it to cook frozen fries and even on the highest heat setting and nearly two hours cooking time, the fries were still under cooked.. It did not brown them at all. I even changed the setting to broil but that didn't do anything. I should have bought a toaster for the bagels/sliced bread. This would have been better in terms of counter space as well. It's not that big and the curved door is convenient and space saving.
customer_reviews.author: OtisPaul

customer_reviews.title: The toaster oven "problem"...solved
customer_reviews.text: Best toaster oven we've ever had. Waited to write this review until we'd used it for a number of months. Love the curved design that also fits nicely on our countertop. Love that the lid lifts up instead of down (and, really when you think about it, how dumb is that?). Super easy to clean with a removable crumb tray that covers the entire bottom. Only minus is the the temperature dial labeling is non-existent, but we've learned to work with it. Kudos to Hamilton Beach for a nifty piece of well-functioning and good-looking industrial design that doesn't need to be parked in the "garage". Appliances don't generally make me smile but this one does.
customer_reviews.author: Reynard

customer_reviews.title: still very happy with this toaster, after one year.
customer_reviews.text: after owning two conventional toaster ovens, this is a big improvement. Especially the roll-back cover that exposes the entire chamber as well as getting the burning hot lid out of your way. My other toaster-ovens were good at baking but just so-so at toasting. This toaster is great at toasting! We bought this one year ago and is used almost every day. I recommend something I noticed in other reviews, put bright paint on the pointers on the knobs, as they are hard to tell where they are pointing.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Kahn

customer_reviews.title: So easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I have never been much of a fan of toaster ovens. Big bulky things that take up too much space, are hard to clean and don't get used much. Well, over time, I have found myself wishing for one a time or ten, so I started my Amazon search. This small, toaster oven not only opens wide to make access easy, but the cover comes right off so it can be cleaned. I managed to make space on my counter and I'm glad I did. This has become a go to appliance in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Solana

customer_reviews.title: I love this toaster! 😊
customer_reviews.text: I love this toaster. I use it almost every day. I love how the top opens up super wide so you can reach in without getting burned on the tops of your hands. I don't know why someone didn't think of that before. Only thing I don't like is that the window piece doesn't come off, and cleaning it is basically impossible. Anyway, it's a great toaster and I would buy the exact same one if I needed a new one. Update: 3 years later, still going strong. I figured out how to remove the toaster door. It's actually super easy to do. I gave it an extra star for being so sturdy and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: elem1313

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the product description. I never knew there is such a thing as a toaster that only heats one side... That is - until I received and used this product. I'm not sure how people use this toaster. I need both sides of my toast to be golden brown and this won't do... As other reviewers have also stated, the timer nor temperature are impossible to set accurately. If you are like me who wants everything to be precise, this item is not for you. The only upside is I appreciate how easy it is to clean. My money was definitely wasted on this toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Yuki

customer_reviews.title: Loud Ticking Toaster Oven Has a Mind of It's Own
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this "loud ticking" toaster oven after just a couple uses. First of all, the enclosed pan warped into a "U" shape when cooking. Then it went back to the regular shape after it cooled off. I never saw a pan do this before and it was scary. Then the last time I used it, I couldn't get it to turn off and it was ticking. I even unplugged it, and it was still ticking! Eventually it turned off but it took a while. By the way, it ticks constantly when it's on! So we got a newer Black & Decker and it's working just fine.
customer_reviews.author: K.O.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have used this toaster almost everyday since it arrived. I am very pleased with it, have not had any problems. Crumb tray is very easy to remove to clean off. Love the slide up door. It is perfect for a smaller place and the large glass front makes it easy to see what is baking or toasting. No longer have to heat the large oven when just making something small for the two of us. Outside heat has not been a problem, I just keep it clear of things surrounding it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Becareful - catches on FIRE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Becareful with this toaster and the drip tray, ours has caught on fire a few times. So if you use it do not leave it unattended. Other than that (not being funny) we like the toaster and the way it is designed. An quick update on this - I finally had to throw the toaster away ( after about 4 to 6 months of having it). it got to where every time we toasted it I was putting out a fire. Now it may have just been a defective toaster and all the others are awesome. But it has scared me enough to post my experience here. I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: phillip brande

customer_reviews.title: Suddenly stops heating
customer_reviews.text: I LOVED this toaster oven for almost two years, and even convinced friends to buy it. Worked great last night and today it suddenly stopped working (light goes on and timer ticks but there is no heat). I contacted HB customer support but there is no accountability on their end since it's over a year from purchase date. If you're okay having a great little oven for less than two years, do it. If you don't want to replace it that soon, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan B

customer_reviews.title: Hamilton Beach Easy Reach Toaster Oven
customer_reviews.text: So far, it meets all of my expectations. Is very attractive, does the job well and fits the footprint of my former toaster oven. In time I will have toast toasted exactly as I like it. Just takes practice, as with anything.\\ UPDATE: I have now used this for 4 months and I do like it for making toast. What I do not like is that the numbers on the timer are NOT there. There is no '10' to wind past as directions state. Thus, I wing it each and every time. There are no little icons for helping determine that amount of toasting. The photo on the oven shows the timer with very distinct dots, icons and numbers.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy R.

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: Needed something smaller for a small space. I like the way the door opens, but you can't clean the inside of it. And I miss having convection capability. Most foods take longer to bake, but toast -- keep an eye on it. It's not toasted and then in a second it almost burns, no matter the setting. Overall, it's fine for my needs, but when it breaks I likely won't be buying another one like this.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily. The little drip pan was stained after the first use which I don't really like, but it doesn't affect anything and still cleans easily (the dark grease spot just won't come off) but that's the only thing that bugs me and I suspect I could get it off if I really scrubbed - but it's clean enough to not smoke or cause any issues so overall, great little oven and I would DEFINITELY buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Kristine

customer_reviews.title: Disappearing labels
customer_reviews.text: So effecient, should have bought the bigger one. Toddler love to help loading it. After which she steps away and I plug in the use. Tray gets brown easily even with the use of foil and is hard to scrub. White lettering is a joke as any grease wiped that off within a month of using it (perhaps sooner). Tricky corners and glass is impossible to clean. I like to clean with diy cleaners and finding an effective one is hard baking soda and water will not do. Time to try a lemon and vodka cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Tizzle Frizzle

customer_reviews.title: Oven helpful to parapeligi
customer_reviews.text: The recipient of this gift is paraplegic and has tremors in his arms. The full opening bar (all the way across the front) with the strong catch at full open position enables him to put food in the oven without getting burned by the door. He can use both hands to locate, insert, and remove the dish. This allows him aa greater degree of independence.
customer_reviews.author: Maribeth

customer_reviews.title: Worked okay for 23 months and then bust
customer_reviews.text: We bought it in May 2018 after great reviews on Amazon and switched from Black and Decker. Within a year the marking on the outside disappeared completely. Also, its even toasting feature worked well for the first few months and then didn’t work at all - you have to place the bread in a certain orientation and location to get it right. This week the toaster wouldn’t turn on at all - just died when we tried to use it. Obviously it’s out of warranty so buying a new one, but with all the Covid issues it’s not easy to get one now.
customer_reviews.author: Amit

customer_reviews.title: It worked great while it lasted :(
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this toaster in January and it has worked great! Then all of a sudden it stopped toasting? Come to find out the timer that you use to turn on the toaster/oven is broken with no parts available to fix it. So now this toaster is only good for the garbage. Of course we didn't save box it came in, it was a toaster oven and we thought it should have lasted longer than 8 months so no way of returning it unless we want to pay as much in shipping as it cost for a different new one. So not happy right now
customer_reviews.author: HBurrows

customer_reviews.title: Defective broiling
customer_reviews.text: The broil function is defective. The top and bottom heating element turns on during the broil function. It is like doing 450 degree baking. So during broiling, top and bottom heating element will turn on and after a while, it will power on and off as the temperature hits 450 degree. I am expecting heating non-stop during broiling and the heat should only comes from the top like any other toaster oven,
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster!
customer_reviews.text: This toaster is a great fit for the kitchen. Not too big or small. Perfect size in my opinion. Fit 4 regular slices of bread. Only 2 slices for larger cut bread. Nice even toast. It's easy to operate and it has an easy to remove tray at the bottom for catching crumbs. The removal door is awesome for easy cleaning. I love this oven I wish I had it a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: TonyFu

customer_reviews.title: as the food tastes much better from the toaster oven
customer_reviews.text: Loooooooooove this toaster oven! My 12 year old loves it too! We make everything in here. I use this more than my microwave now, as the food tastes much better from the toaster oven. I heat up left over pizza in this, make frozen cheese sticks or bread sticks. My son sticks his waffles in here. I always line the bottom part in aluminum foil to avoid having to scrub the heck out of it to clean it. If we want more space, we put the tray on the bottom and put the bread directly on the racks. Super convenient, and I don't have any of the problems others did (door not lining up correctly). I would buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: mexiricandiva

customer_reviews.title: Excellent toaster over, highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, simple, and inexpensive toaster oven. Large window means you can clearly see how your toast is cooking, and top-rolling door gives excellent access to tasty food. Impatient me can now easily remove scalding morsels without hitting my hand on hot bits of oven. Cleans easily, the broiling pan fits *under* the over when not in use, and it's just the right size for my needs. Compatible with Linux without external drivers. Seriously, this is a nice design. I really like this toaster oven.
customer_reviews.author: Chip

customer_reviews.title: Toasts bread much better than Black & Deckers I've owned in the past
customer_reviews.text: Works very well as a baker or toaster.. Toasts bread much better than Black & Deckers I've owned in the past. I like being able to lift the door up; this shape gives more room for items like a small pizza. Only issue is to be very careful of the back, which gets hot when baking. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Really like it.
customer_reviews.text: So it's not perfect. If it were it would toast my toast in seconds instead of minutes but I'm not sure that toaster oven exists in my price range. But it works very well and I love the way it opens more than I thought I would. Great design and an effective appliance.
customer_reviews.author: A. Picture

customer_reviews.title: Second time purchase, great inexpensive toaster oven
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for the same model we used for 5 years in the office. It is great for the price and the amount of use it got. I hope they still make it when I need another in 5 more years. The nobs have been changed a little, I will have to see if those hold up. First few uses have produced toast browned almost perfectly even on both sides (vs one side being overdone and the other underdone).
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster oven
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little toaster oven. It takes up a little more room on the counter than I would like, but it's much better than using the oven. Love the fact that the door will come off for cleaning. So far everything I've cooked or heated in it has come out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cooking and cleans easily
customer_reviews.text: II love this toaster oven. I can slide the door up with just my pinky. I had to adjust to the temperature settings from my old one. This one cooks faster and heats up higher than the old one: 300 degrees here is equivalent to 450 on my old one. I also feel like I can see into the oven more clearly. The Door and the bottom tray slide off easily for cleaning in the sink.
customer_reviews.author: D-C

customer_reviews.title: Very efficient and nice looking
customer_reviews.text: This toaster oven works very well. We've used it for toasting bagels, cooking single serve pizza, and baking a variety of foods. I've lined the pan with aluminum foil and change as needed. I bake the pizza directly on the wire shelf, I lined the bottom with a no stick liner which works out very nicely. Eventually I plan to buy a new baking stone. I especially like the easy reach feature. Thanks to it, I haven't burned myself, plus I can easily remove items from the toaster oven.
customer_reviews.author: Mbeth G.

customer_reviews.title: Disenchanted
customer_reviews.text: While at first I loved this because the size is perfect, the ability to clean all it's parts is unusually easy, I've become disenchanted with it. If one person makes toast then the next person comes along right after them, it doesn't heat up as well. We have taken to leaving it open after use so it cools down faster and works for the next person, then close it up on cleanup. It also makes a lot of noise on start up. Then again, it works almost as well as a dozen others we have owned over the years and is easier to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Chessnut

customer_reviews.title: I can finally make toast without burning it!
customer_reviews.text: I had a much more expensive toaster oven that burnt everything I cooked or toasted. After comparing this oven with my older unit, I think the difference is the cooking surface on this toaster is a little further from the heating element. The roll top door is a very nice feature, making it easier to keep an eye on your what you are cooking and retrieve food. The one downside is the marking on the knobs. Glare from the counter top makes it a bit challenging to see the arrow on the bottom knob -- I may put a little enamel paint on it. Well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: KernsGibbs

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use Toaster Oven
customer_reviews.text: The roll top makes use and cleanup easy. This unit has a small enough footprint to leave in easy access. I look for reasons to use this toaster oven rather than the big oven/broiler. I can watch cooking through the large roll top window. Unlike a regular toaster I can adjust how dark the items are getting just by looking. Not only does it easily toast bread and bagels, but it warms pizza slices, chicken, sandwiches and all other sorts of items. Wish I had purchased this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Toast setting is not repeatable.
customer_reviews.text: Toasts just fine. However, the toast time is set manually each time you toast. The knob must be twisted by guesswork and each time it must be set again. Best results watching toast and rescuing the bread before it burns. But since we are only using this three or four times per month, it is not a big problem. If I were toasting every day, I would want digital settings for toast time.
customer_reviews.author: Gil Woolley

customer_reviews.title: good riddance!
customer_reviews.text: Numbers on dials wear off rapidly. Toasts poorly. Set it at 350 to warm up tacos shells...less than 4 minutes later they are on fire...unplugged and kept door closed, but flames persisted, door does not seal well...ended up carrying it out doors, pouring water on it and cracking the glass into hundreds of pieces...good riddance!
customer_reviews.author: sheilascove

customer_reviews.title: Horrible for toasting, cannot set dial consistently
customer_reviews.text: This toaster oven has an analog timer that you set by rotating a knob. It is nearly impossible to get your toast or bagel or anything else cooked the same way every time. The difference between not done and burnt is about 1 mm on the dial setting. Also this unit ticks like a time bomb, although maybe that's considered a feature because you need to remember to keep looking at what your cooking to make sure it's not burning.
customer_reviews.author: PMC 68

customer_reviews.title: must have in kitchen
customer_reviews.text: so much better than a regular toaster... versatile.. would have given 5 stars except the tray/pan is flimsy and not easy to clean and the painted on indicators around the knobs wore off after first use they might as will not even have put them on there
customer_reviews.author: Shaun P Granato

customer_reviews.title: I love this oven!
customer_reviews.text: Why I love this oven. I purchased to bake clay and the ability to set the temperature precisely is very important. I set this oven to 275 and that is exactly what temp the oven is. I know this is true because I use an oven thermometer to make sure - and it is! Also, I like the way the oven doors slides up and out of your way - great for my clay projects but also would be great for removing food. Just wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Noe

customer_reviews.title: Good toaster oven that doubles as a radiator.
customer_reviews.text: Does a fine job but throws off a lot of heat. I put a folded cotton dish towel over the top and halfway down the glass door for insulation. I especially like the design — sliding door makes footprint smaller and it's very easy to clean. The timer dial is a bit hard to see so I used a Sharpee to mark the indicator nub.
customer_reviews.author: Tough critic

customer_reviews.title: Very dangerous to have it
customer_reviews.text: Please do not buy this toaster, that’s happened tonight when I was trying to warm up food
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I bought this same toaster oven 3 or 4 years ago. It went out after a lot of use. I looked for it again because I liked it so much. It is easy to clean, opens wide so you don't get burned, and is inexpensive compared to some I have had in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Perryman

customer_reviews.title: Great price & a breeze to clean!
customer_reviews.text: We just replaced our old toaster with this and couldn't be more pleased! The price was awesome and it's a breeze to keep clean compared to a nasty toaster. I don't like keeping too many small appliances out on the counter but this one looks sleek and classy! I also enjoy the fact that it's taken over a lot of microwave tasks as well because I'm going through IVF and try to avoid unnecessary radiation.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: A recommended product
customer_reviews.text: Works just as it should. The front roll-up door is neat, because it is not in the way, ever. And it provides good access. I think all low-end toaster ovens now use a timer, rather than a temperature-based control, so that is not a deciding factor. Fit and finish are acceptable. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poorly design
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use less often. Since I bought it I haven’t use it more than 10 or 12 times. I recently noticed there’s a long vertical gap between the glass opener and heat controlling area as you can see in the picture I uploaded. Can not toast or bake anything because smoak coming out from the gap and it spreads all around the house. I don’t use it anymore. I think it’s poorly designed for use
customer_reviews.author: Liyana

customer_reviews.title: love this toaster
customer_reviews.text: the roll top lid sure is easier to use when getting the food in and out of the toaster. The only thing i wish it had was the ability to turn off the lower heating element for a broil option. Everything else works great.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky G Matli

customer_reviews.title: Pros and Con
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very compact, doesn't take up much counter space. Great for small kitchens. Fits Small pizzas or dish for one. Cookies baking sheet included. Cons: There is a larger than normal gap between the roll up door and the control knob panel.
customer_reviews.author: Riggit Tuefit

customer_reviews.title: On a waist high counter the controls are difficult to see (for Me) if possible it would be better set chest high
customer_reviews.text: I think the design has future merit more toasters should incorporate the sliding take off door that moves away from you instead of opening towards you, saves a lot of space, I would have given it a 5 star but it does have a few shortcomings. the knob indicator is difficult to see, the fact that one has to turn it clockwise past the number 10 and then counterclockwise to toast is a nuisance. On a waist high counter the controls are difficult to see (for Me) if possible it would be better set chest high. Otherwise I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvan O salem

customer_reviews.title: Nice, conventient toaster
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a one year old toaster oven that no longer toasts on high. We will have to see how this one holds up. The last two I have owned have done the same thing. This one is nice in that the lid rolls up letting you put your toast or whatever in the right place without burning your hand on the upper element.. If it fails in a year, you will hear from me again.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Marchand

customer_reviews.title: Great value, replaces my big oven for everyday
customer_reviews.text: Though my kitchen is average to big, this toaster makes it so much easier to bake small cakes, tarts, etc and I now use my actual oven less, thank you! The door mechanism is smooth, it preheats to 400 very quickly (I set it to 5-10 minutes and it's much quicker than that) and doesn't hold the smell of pungent foods when cleaned (Ive cooked a small fish in there, and just needed to wipe the inside with a bit of lemon and white vinegar, good as new) . The metal tray that came with it warps when used for foods meant to be cooked from frozen, but not permanently, the shape returns after cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Ebi Suri

customer_reviews.title: RECOMMEND BUYING EXTENDED WARRANTY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Loved everything about this simple, reliable, compact but roomy toaster oven until it abruptly "died" 5 months after 12 month manufactures warranty expired (purchased Nov. 2016: top heating element failed: neither element works when one dies as they are connected/soldered in series). WOULD STRONGLY RECOMMEND BUYING EXTENDED WARRANTY
customer_reviews.author: TucAnasazis

customer_reviews.title: inconsistent toasting on the bottom
customer_reviews.text: this got good reviews but I didn't care for it. It would toast good on top if you placed it right, but underneath the toast was hit and miss, could be alot lighter. It might be this is true on all toaster ovens, I just dont know. But I returned it for that reason, as toast would be my main thing and went back to my old, very old sunbeam toaster. this might work for others but I didn't care for it. I thought the way it opened was very cool by the way..
customer_reviews.author: Irish AngelTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best toaster oven I’ve ever bought and I’ve been through several. It opens easily and has lots of space. My favorite part is that the door comes off for cleaning. I hope they continue to make these for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy this product again. I've owned many "inexpensive" toaster ovens. They're is always a trick to them. They're is no trick. Sometimes it burns food in less than a minute and sometimes it takes forever to toast. It also gets super hot and heats up my kitchen. Wish I could return. I'm going to try the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't heat from above well.
customer_reviews.text: Although the shape, door and access are good, the darn thing doesn't heat from above well or at all. Pizza toast ends up cold in the middle even on the plate provided. I have tried every possible setting to get it to heat from above only or even simply bake but both bulbs come on and things burn quickly. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: DKAero

customer_reviews.title: Good at first, didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: The way the door opens is pretty innovative as it provides a wide opening for reaching in and grabbing your food. However, after less than 2 years, the bottom element is not working as well as it should so things like toast are done inconsistently. The knob doesn't have a detente to differentiate for toast vs bake. Also, it is difficult to judge how far to turn the knob on the timer as all the numbers have disappeared.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lee

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: Aside from being visually interesting, this toaster gets the job done. The multiple crumb catchers keep the bottom clean. And the glass door slides neatly out of the way, so if you're jammed for counter space, like I am, you have room to place a plate. The only downside is the knob controls, which are hard to read and far from accurate. If they combined this design with digital controls, they'd have a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Ronin Vato

customer_reviews.title: beeter by far than my old one
customer_reviews.text: This is quickly becoming one of my favorites in the kitchen. It is compact, easy to use, and easy to clean. I like the ability to remove the door for cleaning, something I coild not do with the one this replaces. I have made meatloaves and roasts in it as well as toasts of different sizes and types. Beat my old one by a mile!
customer_reviews.author: James W Battee

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Works well - everyone loves the way the door gives you access, There is a small gap where u can see into the oven by the knob controls - this is normal (see pic)
customer_reviews.author: BJB

customer_reviews.title: Easy access
customer_reviews.text: I want to give this five stars but I’m not thrilled with the knob to select the toast darkness. It’s hard to see without glasses which I never have close by in the morning when I’m toasting bread. Other than that, it’s a great appliance and I love the sliding door. So easy to access the food inside and very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Hook

customer_reviews.title: It's fine so far and I agree with some of the ...
customer_reviews.text: It's fine so far and I agree with some of the reviews on here. There's a really big door gap opening on the side. The outside surface of the toaster does get really hot so be careful to not put things too close to the toaster. But anyways, for its price, it's a good buy. It works and it's small enough that it fits in smaller areas.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to time.
customer_reviews.text: This toaster is nice to look at on the counter. It can hold four pieces of bread etc. But the knobs are very difficult to get just right. The selection line is just raised silver and not painted. It's also very wide. There are no minute markers under 10 minutes but some crazy whole bread and half bread marks that don't really translate. I am frustrated to have to stand and watch my toast and bagels to make sure they don't burn.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the best purchase. I did a lot of research into ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the best purchase. I did a lot of research into these things and this has proved fantastic. It gets used multiple times a day for a variety of things, we get creative, and it always gets the job done. It doesn't get hot, the top is easy to remove for quick cleaning, and the door slides up so you aren't using lots of counter space.
customer_reviews.author: Zinfadel

customer_reviews.title: Love it, big improvement
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than the one I had, and cheaper. The flip up door is a big improvement and easily comes off to clean, as does the crumb tray. My only concern is a loud buzzing when it starts up.
customer_reviews.author: J S

customer_reviews.title: Not working after six weeks
customer_reviews.text: Heating elements quit about 6 weeks after delivery, after the return window closed. Mostly used for making toast 4-5 times a week.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Teach

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: The oven door doesn't seal, so heat escapes easily, the timer ticks loudly the entire cooking time, and all of the numbers painted around the dials have worn away so that I can no longer tell what my cooking times or temps are. I am very disappointed in this toaster oven.
customer_reviews.author: ThreatLevelMidnight

customer_reviews.title: Toaster Oven Too Small and Too Hot
customer_reviews.text: I've been disappointed in this toaster oven. It is smaller than I had anticipated from reading the reviews of fixing a pizza in it. It runs much hotter than a normal oven and directions for an oven! Even dinner rolls get burned on top but aren't warm throughout! I love the lift up top, but other than that I wouldn't recommend it -- even for a small space requirement.
customer_reviews.author: Hachi88

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent toaster. Not much room to lightly toast on the dial. Otherwise, has been working well. Update almost a year later: I am donating the toaster as I got sick of the inconsistent toasting. Advice for people like me: look for a toaster with a separate toast dial from the timer to keep the same level of toasting each time. I'm super happy with my Cuisinhart TOB 40.
customer_reviews.author: Doing the best I can

customer_reviews.title: Best toaster oven I've ever had.
customer_reviews.text: For such a common item, it's surprisingly hard to find a nice simple toaster oven. This one is by far the best toaster oven I've ever had. The design is great for providing a larger cooking area and still being easy to access food. I also like the simple controls -- no extra bells and whistles -- only the two knobs you need (temperature and on/off/timer). There's also a removable crumb tray, which is much more convenient than other designs.
customer_reviews.author: Steven L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: So the oven seems to work well but the door ...
customer_reviews.text: So the oven seems to work well but the door doesn't fit flush. You can stick a fork into the gap while it's on. I called HB and asked if this was normal to have such a large gap in the door and she said it was. I never cook anything unattended just in case. I can see how fires are frequently reported.
customer_reviews.author: TangoLimaAlpha

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe
customer_reviews.text: This would be an excellent product except for one thing: no ON/OFF switch makes it very unsafe. It's far too easy to turn the timer down past zero which puts it back on again. I resorted to always unplugging, but that's a pain frankly. We had a small in-toaster fire from some over done toast tonight, so out it goes. Too bad because it really is a nice toaster that cleans up easily. PLus the door is removable for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: mbf

customer_reviews.title: Very good compact oven
customer_reviews.text: I like this small oven. I bake rolls, biscuits and other foods in it. The roll top makes it compact. It cooks very well and I am pleased. Easy to cook in and clean this oven.
customer_reviews.author: LF Houston

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster oven
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size. Don’t take a lot of room on counter and I love the fact that the roll top comes off for easy cleaning
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Numbers wear off after about a month. You can't cook those TV dinners with plastic on top in this, it will melt. Both elements burn, no way to use top or bottom separately. Ours is still functioning since March 21, 2017.
customer_reviews.author: MikeFrett

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster oven
customer_reviews.text: My favorite toaster oven ever. It's large door makes it very easy to load and unload your food. I love the large window on the door as well. I highly suggest you buy the additional bake pans. Since I bought this, I haven't baked in my big oven unless I'm baking something like lasagna or a cake. It saves on energy costs and really keeps your kitchen cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Aleta j

customer_reviews.title: The Studebaker of Toaster Ovens:  cute but not sufficiently functional
customer_reviews.text: I call this the "Studebaker" toaster oven. It's unique and I use it in my B&B. But it's approximate in its toasting/heating, a bit noisy, and to toast, you have to manipulate the dials each time you use it. The arced "door" is a bit loose and actually, heat leaks out. I am not getting compliments on my toast, but people find the design to be a curiosity.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Really love this toaster oven
customer_reviews.text: Really love this toaster oven. Pro: Unlike typical toaster ovens, you can evenly cook small items like a single-serve pizza without the top burning before it's done. Con: Toasting is a bit longer than typical toasters. Kinda miss that. Suggest getting "Chef's Planet 401 Nonstick Toaster Oven Liner," which is amazing to keep it clean.
customer_reviews.author: RobM

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to clean because of how the front opens. ...
customer_reviews.text: Impossible to clean because of how the front opens. Also, I can't seem to get the timing right on toast and always end up not toasted enough or too much-unless I stand there and monitor it. Augh.
customer_reviews.author: jspencer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2.5 years.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the design and size of this toaster oven, but it only lasted two and a half years. The device no longer heats up.
customer_reviews.author: John ¥

customer_reviews.title: Love the door - reliability is poor.
customer_reviews.text: Love the door - hate that it has a max life span of 2.5 years. The first one conked out at 2 years! It’s frankly a piece of junk but we like the door.
customer_reviews.author: Marc R.

customer_reviews.title: You still need a lot of oil
customer_reviews.text: These are definitely NOT nonstick, not even close. You couldn't possibly cook in this oil free, and after only about two months of use mine has all kinds of stains and stuff stuck to it permanently which won't come off at all.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: PERFECTO!
customer_reviews.text: Works even better than described by all the other five-star reviews! Makes absolutely PERFECT toast! Bakes perfectly as well, do to its extremely accurate temperature control. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Clever design, easy to store.
customer_reviews.text: Good design, works as expected. I did purchase Chef's Planet 401 Nonstick Toaster Over Liner to line the bottom. (Amazon)
customer_reviews.author: Compassionata

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster, with lots of good features.
customer_reviews.text: I like the compact size of it. The door rolls back so it doesn't take up any counter space. The timer ticks kind of loud so I don't forget that I have something in it when I'm multitasking. It's easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Stormy Rivers

customer_reviews.title: DOOMED
customer_reviews.text: Omg, how do you dare make a oven that gets do hot on the outside that if i lick my finger and put it on back of oven it will sizzle???? This is pure dangerous!!!!!!!!!!! the tray that comes with it curls right up when the heat is on. un real. I'm gonna have to return. Its like a fire or a burnt person waiting to happen. I really can't believe it. I read the reviews and no one said anything.
customer_reviews.author: betmax

customer_reviews.title: This does everything I want a toaster oven to do ...
customer_reviews.text: This does everything I want a toaster oven to do. Pro: the door opens such that it takes up less space. Con: toast function is tricky, no "ding" to indicate it's finished.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Bones

customer_reviews.title: Very compact...I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I use it daily, and it has never failed. I've cook an entire rack of ribs in it, believe it or not....it was a cold day and I was lazy, but I did eat some really good ribs!
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: I am disappointed that the timer has already stopped working
customer_reviews.text: We've had this toaster oven for a year. While it's worked well over-all for an inexpensive toaster oven, I am disappointed that the timer has already stopped working. Updating 4 months later: Just almost had a fire because the toaster doesn't turn off unless you turn the dial manually. Time to throw this thing out and get something that works properly!
customer_reviews.author: Ifyousaygo

customer_reviews.title: No Patience
customer_reviews.text: Love Toaster ovens!! This one is compact & smooth. Only issue I have is the time it takes to toast.... I have zero patience & it annoys me I have to wait 3 min for brown toast, 5 min if I get it the way I really like it
customer_reviews.author: Holly  Still

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.text: Still holding up after a year (or two?) of daily use!
customer_reviews.author: Melo

customer_reviews.title: Not great quality.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this toaster oven for more than six months and the white numbers on the bottom tab faded a few months ago. Looking to replace this toaster oven soon. Not great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: replaced a more expensive toaster oven with this. Works ...
customer_reviews.text: replaced a more expensive toaster oven with this. Works well, perhaps a little slow to toast but it toasts fairly evenly
customer_reviews.author: garden pal

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.text: Not to crazy about this toaster b/c you literally have to stand there and wait so your item doesn't burn. You have to set the timer past 10 minutes or else it won't toast very well. Very disappointed in this product. Wish I could of returned it. Waited to long that was my bad.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn C. Powers

customer_reviews.title: Toaster is great, controls need work!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this toaster oven in red but they send grey metal. I needed it so I kept it. It toasts and bakes well but the controls are horrible. There are no indications for light or dark selections. Whatever markings there are for the dial wipe off almost immediately. The toaster should be called "Guess ware". I like the front overhead opening although the tray has a tendency to come out with the bread or pan. It's a shame. A little more care on the part of the manufacturer would have made this a great appliance!
customer_reviews.author: Edith S.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, and the "easy reach" door is really handy
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my boyfriend and he LOVES it. He uses it almost every night when he's alone and cook every sort of small meals in it. I am actually impressed. Only thing is it's very light so I am not sure how long it will last. So far so good, and the "easy reach" door is really handy.
customer_reviews.author: E.B.

customer_reviews.title: Timer and Temperature numbers rub off
customer_reviews.text: The time and temperature indicators have rubbed off. I can no longer tell what temperature or time settings . This is less then 1 year old and is a fire hazard. HB is replacing with same model
customer_reviews.author: CGS

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous Fire Hazard
customer_reviews.text: Dangerous, do not buy! After about a year this toaster oven no longer shuts off after the bell dings and food is removed. We've noticed several times we've walked away with our food only to return later and find the oven still running. This is a fire hazard. Throwing it out!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it!
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't toast evenly. There is no setting that delivers basic toast. By that I mean it does have settings for various shades but say, a medium brown, even toast just does not happen. The cover does not fit snugly to the rest of the unit, so a lot of heat escapes. Has coils at top and bottom. Potentially a well-designed product but too many flaws.
customer_reviews.author: susan  craig

product_meta.title: Hamilton Beach (31334) Toaster Oven, Pizza Maker, Electric, Gray
product_meta.description:
Color:GrayYou won’t find a design like the Hamilton Beach Easy Reach Toaster Oven with Roll-Top Door anywhere else. Its unique and large opening make food easy to reach. And since the door opens above the oven, it frees up your countertop space in front. Best of all, it’s easy to keep clean because food can’t spill on the door.

With a 4 slice toast capacity and three cooking settings, you can enjoy everything from crispy toast, broiled fish and mouthwatering roasted vegetables. Easy dials make it simple to choose bake, broil and toast settings. And two rack positions allow you to cook a wider variety of foods to their specifications. It also features a 30 minute timer with auto shutoff, so you know when your food is ready. Or you can choose an optional stay-on setting for food requiring more time. The Easy Reach Toaster Oven comes with a bake pan, oven rack, and removable crumb tray.
feature_bullets: Easy to keep clean - food can't spill on door
Bake, broil and toast settings. Fits 4 slices of toast or 9 inch pizza30 minute timer with auto shutoff and optional stay on setting
Actual product color varies and may be darker than shown

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars1,512 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
